title: Firstfruits and Covenant
shortSummary: Deuteronomy 26 outlines the instructions for presenting the firstfruits to the Lord upon entering the Promised Land, including a declaration of God's faithfulness and Israel's history. It also emphasizes the importance of tithing, obedience to God's commandments, and the covenant relationship between God and His people.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - Israel's Entry into the Promised Land

keyCharacters.name: Israelite
keyCharacters.description: The individual presenting the firstfruits and declaring the history and faithfulness of God as part of covenant obedience.

keyCharacters.name: Priest
keyCharacters.description: The religious leader who receives the basket of firstfruits and serves as mediator in the worship and covenant ceremony.

keyCharacters.name: Levite
keyCharacters.description: Members of the tribe of Levi who receive tithes and are supported by the community, representing God's appointed servants.

definitions.definition: The initial yield of the harvest offered to God as an act of worship and recognition of His provision.
A tenth part of one's increase or income given to God, often used to support the Levites, strangers, orphans, and widows.
A foreigner or sojourner living among Israel who is to be cared for according to God's commands.

definitions.term: Land flowing with milk and honey
definitions.definition: A biblical phrase describing the fertility and abundance of the Promised Land given by God to Israel.

outline.heading: Instructions for Presenting Firstfruits
outline.description: God commands the Israelites to bring the firstfruits of their harvest in a basket to the chosen place of worship and present it to the priest as an act of dedication.

outline.heading: Declaration of God's Faithfulness
outline.description: The presenter recites Israel's history from their ancestor's humble beginnings, through affliction in Egypt, to God's mighty deliverance and provision of the Promised Land, culminating in worship and rejoicing.

outline.heading: Tithing and Social Responsibility
outline.description: Instructions for the third-year tithe emphasize generosity toward the Levite, stranger, fatherless, and widow, accompanied by a confession of obedience and purity in giving.

outline.heading: Covenant Renewal and Blessing
outline.description: The people affirm their commitment to God's statutes and commandments, and God confirms Israel as His chosen people, set apart to be exalted among the nations.

application: Offer the first and best of your resources to God as a tangible expression of gratitude and trust in His provision.
Remember and proclaim God's faithfulness in your life history to strengthen your faith and witness to others.
Practice generosity by supporting those in need within your community, reflecting God's heart for the vulnerable.
Commit wholeheartedly to obeying God's commands as a response to His covenant love and blessing.

keyVerses.text: And now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land, which thou, O LORD, hast given me. And thou shalt set it before the LORD thy God, and worship before the LORD thy God:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the act of dedicating the firstfruits to God, symbolizing recognition of His ownership and provision.

keyVerses.text: Thou hast avouched the LORD this day to be thy God, and to walk in his ways, and to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and to hearken unto his voice:
keyVerses.significance: It expresses Israel's solemn covenant commitment to serve and obey God wholeheartedly.

keyVerses.text: And to make thee high above all nations which he hath made, in praise, and in name, and in honour; and that thou mayest be an holy people unto the LORD thy God, as he hath spoken.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals God's promise to exalt Israel as a holy and honored nation through covenant faithfulness.
